permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Loyalty account ID.

params.name: description
params.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

params.name: type
params.doc: Type of the `Adjust Points` call.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

docs.summary:
Adjusts the point balance of a loyalty account.

You can adjust the balance in two ways:
- `balance` allows you to set the total points balance to this new amount.
- `amount` allows you to adjust the points balance by this amount. This amount can be a positive number to increase the points balance or a negative number to decrease the balance.

An account may not be adjusted to result in a negative balance. If you pass an integer in both the `balance` and the `amount` parameters then the `balance` adjustment takes effect and the
`amount` adjustment is ignored.

examples.title: Adjust account balance
body:
curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/loyalty-accounts/v1/accounts/e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7/adjust-points' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-raw '{
        "accountId": "01e34b81-4e48-43e4-b178-c84f3b968574",
        "description": "Sync from external program",
        "balance": 15,
        "revision": "3"
  }'

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: contactId
params.doc:
Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

docs.summary:
Creates a loyalty account for one of a site's contacts.

To create a new loyalty account, the customer must first be a site contact with a contact ID. See the Contacts API to
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object). The site must also
have an active loyalty program before loyalty accounts can be created. See the activate loyalty program endpoint
[to activate a site's loyalty program](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/program/activate-loyalty-program).

examples.title: Create an account for the contact

permissions.name: Manage Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to manage the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Loyalty account ID.

params.name: amount
params.doc:
Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9999999`

params.name: description
params.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

params.name: appId
params.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

params.name: idempotencyKey
params.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

params.name: activityType
params.doc:
Activity type

If points were earned through automation it should be set to trigger key.

params.name: orderId
params.doc: Order id which was source of this transaction.

docs.summary:
Adds points to a loyalty account.

Only a positive amount can be added using the earn points endpoint. To adjust an account's balance
for a negative amount, use [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).

examples.title: Add points to account
body:
curl -X POST \
  'https://www.wixapis.com/loyalty-accounts/v1/accounts/e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7/earn-points' \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data-raw '{
          "accountId": "e6f39a5b-a6d0-4556-b889-0cf09d8a84f7",
          "amount": 10,
          "description": "For subscribing to the newsletter",
          "appId": "db9c3016-ff93-4105-bdef-ff852f3c74c0",
          "idempotencyKey": "baa05589-20d1-45db-ba29-99920bccf37e"

Retrieves the account belonging to the specified contact or member.

This endpoint retrieves loyalty accounts using either a customer's contact ID or member ID. Your app can also retrieve an account
using the loyalty account ID by using the [Get Account endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/get-account-by-secondary-id).

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

docs.summary:
Retrieves the total amount of points earned, redeemed, and adjusted for the entire loyalty program.

The `balance` is the current total of points outstanding, while the `earned`, `adjusted`, and `redeemed` amounts
are the historically accumulated amounts. The totals include the amounts for all loyalty accounts.

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: id
params.doc: Transaction ID.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a transaction using the transaction ID.

A loyalty transaction includes any activity that changes a loyalty account point balance, such as adjusting, earning, or redeeming loyalty points.
To retrieve all of the transactions for a specific loyalty account, use [List Transactions](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/list-transactions).

permissions.name: Read Loyalty
permissions.description: Request permission to read the site's installed Wix Loyalty Program, including program and accounts.

params.name: contactIds
params.doc: List of contact IDs. See the [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) to learn more.

params.name: cursorPaging.limit
params.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

params.name: cursorPaging.cursor
params.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of accounts, given the provided filters.

You can retrieve selected loyalty accounts with an array of `contactIds` or retrieve a list of all of a site's loyalty accounts
with an empty request parameter. Use the `cursorPaging` parameters to limit how many items load at a time.

members.name: body
members.doc: Event body

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Current point balance.

Equal to the sum of `earned` and `adjusted` points, minus `redeemed` points.

members.name: earned
members.doc: Total earned points.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: redeemed
members.doc: Total redeemed points.

members.name: expired
members.doc: Total expired points.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: ID of the reward that was redeemed.

members.name: rewardType
members.doc: Type of reward that was redeemed.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc:
ID of the specific item that was redeemed in this transaction.

Each reward that is redeemed has a unique `referenceEntityId`.

docs.summary:
A loyalty account stores a customer's loyalty points balance. A site's customers can earn points to their account
and redeem those points for rewards.

members.name: id
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: points
members.doc: Information about the account totals.

members.name: latestTransaction
members.doc: Details of the account's latest transaction.

members.name: rewardAvailable
members.doc: Whether the account has a reward available. `true` if the amount of points in `points.balance` are enough to redeem for a reward.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was last updated.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Account's last activity date and time.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the loyalty account is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty account.

Ignored when creating an account.

members.name: tier
members.doc:
Tier information.

The Loyalty Tiers API is currently unavailable, but the program may be activated and managed from a site's
[loyalty dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Floyalty-accounts/wizard/).

members.name: contact
members.doc: Contact information

members.name: pointsExpiration
members.doc: Points expiration information

members.name: id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount of earned, adjusted, or redeemed points in the latest transaction.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Transaction type.

+ `"EARN"`: Points were earned by the customer taking an action. See [Earn Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).
+ `"REDEEM"`: Points were redeemed by the customer for a reward.
+ `"ADJUST"`: Point balance was manually adjusted to a loyalty account. See [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).
+ `"GIVE"`: Points were manually added to or subtracted from a loyalty account. See [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).
+ `"REFUND"`: Points were refunded for a previously redeemed reward. See [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).

members.name: description
members.doc:
Description of the latest transaction.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the transaction was created.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `"ADJUST"`, `"EARN"`, or `"GIVE"`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc:
Additional information for redeemed points.

Only present if `type` is `"REDEEM"`.

docs.summary:
Tier information.

The Tiers API is currently unavailable, but the program may be activated and managed from a site's
[loyalty dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Floyalty-accounts/wizard/).

members.name: id
members.doc:
Tier ID.

This field will not be returned if the account belongs to the base tier.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the tier information was last recalculated.

members.name: points
members.doc: Points earned and adjusted over the tier's current rolling window.

docs.summary: Loyalty account's contact information

members.name: id
members.doc: Contact's id

members.name: name
members.doc: Contact's firstName & lastName concatenated

members.name: picture
members.doc: Contact's profile picture

members.name: email
members.doc: Contact's email

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Contact's firstName & lastName concatenated, or email if name doesn't exist

members.name: width

members.name: expirationDate

members.name: expiringPointsAmount
members.doc: Amount of points that are going to expire at that date.

members.doc: Merged account.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: kind
members.doc: The kind of value.

members.name: nullValue
members.doc: Represents a null value.

members.name: numberValue
members.doc: Represents a double value.

members.name: stringValue
members.doc: Represents a string value.

members.name: boolValue
members.doc: Represents a boolean value.

members.name: structValue
members.doc: Represents a structured value.

members.name: listValue
members.doc: Represents a repeated `Value`.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: aggregations
members.doc: Aggregations | Faceted search: refers to a way to explore large amounts of data by displaying summaries about various partitions of the data and later allowing to narrow the navigation to a specific partition.

members.name: search
members.doc: Free text to match in searchable fields

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
UTC offset or IANA time zone. Valid values are
 ISO 8601 UTC offsets, such as +02:00 or -06:00,
 and IANA time zone IDs, such as Europe/Rome

 Affects all filters and aggregations returned values.
 You may override this behavior in a specific filter by providing
 timestamps including time zone. e.g. `"2023-12-20T10:52:34.795Z"`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc:
Cursor pointing to page of results.
 When requesting 'cursor_paging.cursor', no `filter`, `sort` or `search` can be provided.

members.name: mode
members.doc: Defines how separate search terms in `expression` are combined

members.name: expression
members.doc: Search term or expression

members.name: fields
members.doc: Fields to search in. If empty - will search in all searchable fields. Use dot notation to specify json path

members.name: fuzzy
members.doc: Flag if should use auto fuzzy search (allowing typos by a managed proximity algorithm)

members.name: from
members.doc: Inclusive lower bound of the range. Required if to is not given

members.name: to
members.doc: Exclusive upper bound of the range. Required if from is not given

members.name: buckets
members.doc: List of range buckets, where during aggregation each entity will be placed in the first bucket where its value falls into based on provided range bounds

members.name: addToBucket
members.doc: Can specify custom bucket name. Defaults are [string -> "N/A"], [int -> "0"], [bool -> "false"] ...

members.name: sortType
members.doc: Should sort by number of matches or value of the field

members.name: sortDirection
members.doc: Should sort in ascending or descending order

members.name: limit
members.doc: How many aggregations would you like to return? Can be between 1 and 250. 10 is the default.

members.name: missingValues
members.doc: Should missing values be included or excluded from the aggregation results. Default is EXCLUDE

members.name: includeOptions
members.doc: Options for including missing values

members.name: type

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type

members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Subscription status.

+ `UNKNOWN`: Default status.
+ `AUTO_RENEW_ON`: Subscription is active and automatically renews at the end of the current billing cycle.
+ `AUTO_RENEW_OFF`: Subscription is active but expires at the end of the current billing cycle.
+ `MANUAL_RECURRING`: Subscription is active and renews at the end of the current billing cycle, in case the customer takes an action related to the payment.
+ `CANCELLED`: Subscription isn't active because it has been canceled.
+ `TRANSFERRED`: Subscription isn't active because it has been transferred to a different account. A different active subscription was created for the target account.

docs.summary: Information about the cancellation flow including who canceled the subscription and why it was canceled.

members.name: cancellationCode
members.doc:
Cancellation code. 

Values supported for cancellations on behalf of the billing system: `-1`, `-2`, `-3`, `-4`, `-5`, `-6`, `-7`, `-8`.  
For cancellations on behalf of the site owner or the service provider `cancellationCode`
is taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).

+ `-1`: The subscription has been cancelled by the billing system but none of the listed cancellation reasons applies.
+ `-2`: There were payment problems.
+ `-3`: There was a chargeback.
+ `-4`: Customer support has canceled the subscription and issued a refund.
+ `-5`: The site owner has changed their existing subscription.
+ `-6`: The subscription has been transferred to a different Wix account.
+ `-7`: The subscription has been canceled because the site owner hasn't manually authenticated the recurring payment during the subscription's grace period. For example, site owners must manually confirm recurring payments within 40 days when paying with boleto.
+ `-8`: The Wix account that the subscription belonged to has been deleted.

members.name: cancellationReason
members.doc:
Cancellation reason. For cancellations on behalf of the site owner or the service provider `cancellationReason`
is taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).
For cancellations on behalf of the billing system `cancellationReason` is `null` or an empty string.

members.name: initiator
members.doc:
Initiator of the cancellation. For `"USER_REQUESTED"` and `"APP_MANAGED"`,
`cancellationCode` and `cancellationReason` are taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately)
or [Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).
For `"PASSIVE"`, cancellations `cancellationCode` is automatically calculated and `cancellationReason` 
is `null` or an empty string.

+ `"UNKNOWN`: Default value.
+ `"USER_REQUESTED"`:  The Wix account owner has canceled the subscription.
+ `"APP_MANAGED"`: The service provider has canceled the subscription.
+ `"PASSIVE"`: The billing system has canceled the subscription. For example, in case of payment failure or fraud.

Triggered when a subscription was updated including when its product has been
up- or downgraded or the billing cycle is changed.

members.doc: Billing cycle before the update.

members.doc: ID of the product belonging to the subscription before the update.

members.name: previousProductTypeId
members.doc: ID of the product type that the subscription's original product belonged to before the update.

members.name: contractSwitchType
members.doc:
Update type. __Note__: Doesn't include information about a product adjustment.
For that purpose, see `productAdjustment`.

+ `"NOT_APPLICABLE"`: Default value.
+ `"ADDITIONAL_QUANTITY"`: An increased usage quota is added to the subscription. For example, a second mailbox is added to a subscription that previously included a single mailbox.
+ `"CREDIT_UNUSED_PERIOD"`: The subscription is upgraded and the new price is less than the regular price. The new price applies to every billing cycle, not just the first cycle.
+ `"REFUND_PRICE_DIFF"`: Not implemented.
+ `"ADJUST_PERIOD_END"`: Not implemented.
+ `"DOWNGRADE_GRACE_PERIOD"`: For downgrades during the grace period. In this situation, the site owner hasnt paid yet and must immediately pay for the downgraded subscription.
+ `"FULL_AMOUNT_PERIOD"`: For upgrades in which the site owner retains unused benefits. For example, site owners upgrading a Facebook Ads subscription retain their unused FB Ads credit. The unused credit is added to the new credit.
+ `"END_OF_PERIOD"`: The subscription's billing current cycle is extended because of a downgrade.
+ `"PENDING_CHANGES"`: The subscription's billing is updated, but the change doesn't apply immediately. Instead, the update becomes effective at the end of current billing cycle.
+ `"DOWNGRADE_RENEWAL"`: The subscription is downgraded because of a declined payment. This prevents subscriptions from churning.

members.name: previousMetaSiteId
members.doc:
ID of the metasite the subscription has been assigned to previously.
Available only in case the subscription is assigned to a different site.

members.name: contractSwitchReason
members.doc:
Update reason.

+ `"PRICE_INCREASE"`: The subscription's price has been increased.
+ `"EXTERNAL_PROVIDER_TRIGGER"`: Any reason other than a price increase.

members.name: productPriceIncreaseData
members.doc: Information about the price update. Available only for updates with a price increase.

members.name: productAdjustment
members.doc:
Information about a product adjustment. For example, a downgrade.
__Note__: This isn't the same as `contractSwitchType`.

+ `NOT_APPLICABLE`: There is no information about whether the product has been up- or downgraded.
+ `DOWNGRADE`: The product has been downgraded.

members.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

members.name: activityType
members.doc:
Activity type

If points were earned through automation it should be set to trigger key.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: Order id which was source of this transaction.

members.name: account
members.doc: Updated loyalty account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

members.name: type
members.doc: Type of the `Adjust Points` call.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999999999`

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9999999`

Max: `9999999`

members.name: refund
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Also account's "redeemed points" is reduced by this amount.
Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9999999`

Max: `9999999`

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of times the given reward will be redeemed. Must be a positive whole number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when redeeming points.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc: Id of the entity that is being redeemed (e.g. orderId for order discount, couponId for coupon reward).

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_AGGREGATION_TYPE
  • VALUE - An aggregation where result buckets are dynamically built - one per unique value
  • RANGE - An aggregation, where user can define set of ranges - each representing a bucket
  • SCALAR - A single-value metric aggregation - e.g. min, max, sum, avg
  • DATE_HISTOGRAM - An aggregation, where result buckets are dynamically built - one per time interval (hour, day, week, etc.)
  • NESTED - Multi-level aggregation, where each next aggregation is nested within previous one

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SCALAR_TYPE
  • COUNT_DISTINCT - Count of distinct values
  • MIN - Minimum value
  • MAX - Maximum value
  • SUM - Sum of values
  • AVG - Average of values

Possible values are:
  • OR - Any of the search terms must be present
  • AND - All search terms must be present

Possible values are:
  • COUNT - Should sort by number of matches
  • VALUE - Should sort by value of the field alphabetically

Possible values are:
  • DESC - Should sort in descending order
  • ASC - Should sort in ascending order

Possible values are:
  • EXCLUDE - Should missing values be excluded from the aggregation results
  • INCLUDE - Should missing values be included in the aggregation results
